column4: can anyone tell me if i should be installing 64bit Heron or 32bit Heron on my core 2 duo?
so why not 64bit?
Use 32bit, if you do'nt know if you need 64bit.
Do you have a desktop computer or a server?
desktop
No all sofware you'll probabely intend to use will exists as 64bit.
E.g. some common used plugins for web browsers
How much RAM you have?
: 3gb
No need to use 64bit from that point of view.
so i won't be missing out on some super speed gain by keeping it with 3bit?
For 99% not.
Some things even might be slower on 64bit.
If you inted to set up a server (web, database, java applicaiton, ...), we will answer: Yes, choose 64bit.
i do do development, so i would intend to use it for that stuff some of the time, but it's still gotta function as a normal desktop as well...
Don't do, offert it at ebay :)
: huh?
: u lost me
Or even try to boot with it. You'll see if it's running. With the time, the restrictions mentioned with desktop applications will fall.
do you think one day desktop users will all be using 64bit apps, or do you think 32bit may be a sweet spot?

The common amount of RAM in a PC will rise further. At more than 3GB, there's some oddity on the common 32bit memory layout on PCs - for Linux and for Windows, too . From that, 64bit will break through.
